name: Hotel De La Paix, Cha Am Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Alila Chaam is stylish and sexy and breaks the conventional rules of beach resorts. The modern design and architecture is modern but the feel is homey. The level of attention to service, detail and the overall guest experience is superb. The rooms are well appointed with a minimalist look but a maximalist approach! 3.8 meter high rainshower, apple TV, ultra high speed wifi internet!
reviews.title: Stylish and Sexy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Motion restaurant serves Thai and international food, but the Thai food is highly recommended! Tastes that are flavourful and true to the culinary style of traditional Thai food. Cloud Loft the rooftop fine dining restaurant also serves as the perfect location for sunset cocktails.
reviews.title: Still one of the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, the Alila Cha-am was fantastic. It is the combination of design and being family friendly that makes this place amazing. Sitting on a almost empty beach outside Cha-am, away from the Hua Hin crowds with beautiful seaviews, elevated outdoor restaurant, and very spacious rooms and bathrooms. Again, still the best rainshower ever.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - second to none.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We searched and searched for a place to spend a few days in between two appointments in Bangkok. The Alila was mentioned in Conde Nast Traveler magazine, so we checked it out on Trip Advisor. The resort is heaven. You get there after a 2 hour car ride and you immediately relax. The people are fantastic. The place is modern and gorgeous. The food terrific. The service is impeccable. The music is relaxing. We were in Room 334, and we had views of the ocean and the Cloud Restaurant. The spa is fabulous. We had treatments every day. There is a driver to take you to Hua Hin and back everyday. The sun was hot, so we tried to go, but ended up coming right back with the driver. The apple music is great. The flat panel tv great. the room is huge. you could live there. the bathroom exceptional and the smells lovely. The "rain" shower is unbelievable. We are very picky. We could not find one thing wrong with this place. It was truly amazing. when we got back to Bangkok, we bought jasmine oil and an oil burner to remember the smell. and we bought the cd that they played for us everynight from the loft. it was really a great experience. we highly recommend this place for couples who really want to get away from the stress. bring your work... free wireless is in the room. but also relax.
reviews.title: Perfect Destination. Heaven.

likes.liked: — the ambiance, the staff, the food, the spa, the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at Alila Cha Am to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. What more could we say about the property; its a feast to the eyes. From the moment you arrived at the lobby to last seconds before you close your eyes; everything is heavenly. What makes any property complete its the people/staff. They are very detail and patience. Of course; at times we may have a little communication issue; but easily forgotten; because we know they always give their best. My wife, audrey, had great fun at the pastry making lesson with pastry chef Norasaed.( a must do activity) And for Joel, The executive Chef; he is always so friendly and accommodating. A visit to the nearby fishing village is also highly recommended. Bicycles are free from Alila; 15 mntues of leisure cycling get you to the local communities. Have a look at my pics( I am a photographer); a picture indeed speaks a thousand words......... we are now not only Amanjunkies but also Alilajunkies.....
reviews.title: We are now call AlilaJunkies.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have a very modern design - note that there are no lifts in this development, so people with mobility issues be aware. The room abounds with entertainment options - an Apple TV and a brilliant sound system. However, the jewel of the crown is the rain shower in the bathroom - mounted off the high ceiling, it has two settings and is to die for. I hear that guests love it so much they take 4-5 showers a day.
reviews.title: Amazing modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel doesn't have much in terms of facilities. There are two small-ish lap pools, a reading room and that's about it. It has a good 'artificial' beach and pleasant deck chairs. Food in the restaurants is relatively affordable, i.e. they don't rip you off, so one could conceivably not leave the hotel. (esp since the hotel is in the middle of nowhere) There is a weekend BBQ on the beach - the selection of food isn't great but the grills are well done and the ambience is really nice.
reviews.title: Alila Cha am - Slice of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and minimalist. I would understand some not finding the decor very appealing, which I think leans towards the younger, hip crowd (bare walls, minimal decorations but form and function still there). The larger-than-usual rain shower is impressive, as is the bathtub featured in every room. Restaurants feature fantastic setting and pretty good food. Staff excellent attitude and lots of complimentary activities for families with children and tourists. One downside is the beach isn't the spectacular beach you can find in Phuket but this is Cha Am after all. Beach chairs/cabanas very nice. Two pools for you to choose, both stunning. Staff come around with scented cold towels and water every once in a while. This extra touch, although small, goes to show the hotel's focus on service.
reviews.title: Comtemporary luxury with exceptional service.

description: Hotel de la Paix is the first stylish, boutique resort in the charming coastal town of Cha-Am on the north west coast of the Gulf of Thailand closeby the famous resort town of Hua Hin. Located just 20 minutes drive from Hua Hin airport, it's bold, unconventional design fused with luxurious contemporary living makes it one of the region's hottest resorts. White sand beaches, leafy palm trees and azure waters provide the backdrop for this tropical getaway, and the resort's maze of interconnected pathways, private terraces and courtyards incorporates as much of this natural beauty as possible. For leisure and fun there are two pools: an active pool for family fun near the beach, and an adults only chill pool next to the spa. Guests can enjoy nature walks, kayak tours, mountain bike rides, water sports, cultural sight-seeing, culinary instruction or golf at one of the eight, internationally-acclaimed courses near the resort. From the grand entrance stairway to the rooftop reflecting pool, every detail is understated yet unforgettable.
